content:
• Monday, March 11, 2013
  • CQB

    More on Chiquita Brands (NYSE:CQB) Q4 beats on revenue, but net losses widen on lower retail...

    More on Chiquita Brands (NYSE:CQB) Q4 beats on revenue, but net losses widen on lower retail salad results and the impact of European currency rates, though these issues were partially offset by stronger banana pricing and savings associated with its value chain and corporate restructurings. Banana sales were up 2.3% to $486M, while salad and healthy snacks sales were flat at $223M. Shares +3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:28 PM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL): Q4 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $36.3M beats by...

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL): Q4 EPS of -$0.07 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $36.3M beats by $1.51M. Shares -2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • NES

    More on Heckmann's (HEK) Q4 results: Issues in-line guidance for FY 2013, seeing revenues...

    More on Heckmann's (HEK) Q4 results: Issues in-line guidance for FY 2013, seeing revenues of $750M-$825M vs. $780M consensus, adjusted EBITDA of $200M-$220M, and capex of $90M-$110M. Expects 2013 activity to ramp up from the 2012 slowdown and early-2013 inclement weather impacted activity. Plans to rename the company Nuverra Environmental Solutions. Shares +10.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM | 3 Comments
  • NES

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: HEK +10%. IRBT +10%. PAY +8%. YUM +6%. HTZ +6%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: HEK +10%. IRBT +10%. PAY +8%. YUM +6%. HTZ +6%.
    After-hours top losers: PWRD -9%. DMND -6%. GOV-OLD -5%. [PCRX -5%. SLCA -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM
  • BIOS

    More on BioScrip (NASDAQ:BIOS): Q4 easily beats across the board on a 14% rise in total sales....

    More on BioScrip (NASDAQ:BIOS): Q4 easily beats across the board on a 14% rise in total sales. Gross profit from continuing operations was 33.4% of revenue, as compared to 37.0% in the prior year period. For FY13, the company sees revenues in a range of $830M to $865M and is initially targeting 2013 Adjusted EBITDA of $67M to $73M. Analysts are forecasting revenues of $769.9M and EBITDA of $67.8M. Shares +8.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • LAKE

    Lakeland Industries (NASDAQ:LAKE) reports several material developments including: lower than...

    Lakeland Industries (NASDAQ:LAKE) reports several material developments including: lower than expected sales in Brazil coupled with an $11.5M goodwill impairment charge for the quarter resulting in anticipated operating loss in the region, and a potential default on its line of credit with TD Bank. Shares -23% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • IRBT

    iRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT) +8.2% AH after: 1) Raising Q1 guidance. Citing strong home robot and...

    iRobot (NASDAQ:IRBT) +8.2% AH after: 1) Raising Q1 guidance. Citing strong home robot and defense/security sales, the company now expects revenue of $102M-$104M and EPS of $0.16-$0.20, above prior guidance of $98M-$102M and $0.00-$0.07, and a consensus of $100.4M and $0.02. 2) Announcing CFO John Leahy is leaving to join a "late-stage private company," and will be replaced by principal accounting officer Alison Dean. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • PWRD

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q4 EPS of $0.47 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $109.1M. Shares -4.7%...

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q4 EPS of $0.47 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $109.1M. Shares -4.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • BIOS

    Bioscrip (NASDAQ:BIOS): Q4 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $180.7M (+14.2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Bioscrip (NASDAQ:BIOS): Q4 EPS of $0.04 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $180.7M (+14.2% Y/Y) beats by $6.83M. Shares +4.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • STEI

    Stewart Enterprises (NASDAQ:STEI): FQ1 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $135.6M beats by...

    Stewart Enterprises (NASDAQ:STEI): FQ1 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $135.6M beats by $5.66M. Shares +3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • DMND

    More on Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): FQ2 misses on all counts as nut sales weakened, but net...

    More on Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): FQ2 misses on all counts as nut sales weakened, but net earnings swung to a profit as the snack-food company's operating expenses declined. Gross margin widened to 22.9% from 16% as input costs slipped 23%. Shares -0.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM
  • GST

    Gastar Exploration (NYSEMKT:GST): Q4 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $17.4M misses by...

    Gastar Exploration (NYSEMKT:GST): Q4 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $17.4M misses by $1.5M. Shares +2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • YUM

    Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) reports same-store sales in China -20% in Q1 vs. its earlier estimate of...

    Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM) reports same-store sales in China -20% in Q1 vs. its earlier estimate of 25%. February same-store sales registered a sequential gain of about 2%. For the full quarter thus far, the impact of the Chinese New Year is judged as neutral. Shares +7.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • EMAN

    eMagin (NYSEMKT:EMAN): Q4 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $8.33M misses by $0.77M....

    eMagin (NYSEMKT:EMAN): Q4 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $8.33M misses by $0.77M. Shares -10% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY) +8.3% AH after announcing CEO Douglas Berenson is stepping down, effective...

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY) +8.3% AH after announcing CEO Douglas Berenson is stepping down, effective tomorrow, and that chairman Rich McGinn will serve as interim CEO while a search commences for a full-time successor. Director Leslie Denend will serve as interim chairman. Berenson, who is also resigning from VeriFone's board, has been CEO since 2001. The company's recent troubles seem to be responsible for his departure. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q4 EPS of $0.56 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $856.8M beats by...

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q4 EPS of $0.56 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $856.8M beats by $8.6M. Shares -2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): Q4 EPS of $0.05 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $220.8M misses by...

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND): Q4 EPS of $0.05 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $220.8M misses by $18.23M. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • TROX

    Tronox (TROX -1.2%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy with a $20 target price (from $24) at BWS...

    Tronox (TROX -1.2%) is downgraded to Hold from Buy with a $20 target price (from $24) at BWS Financial, which says a rumored acquisition would not help shareholders, and cites a risk of TiO2 prices not rising this year: Without TiO2 prices roaring back, the firm says TROX would end up with a levered balance sheet and could end up not having a natural hedge against feedstock price volatility.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +1.5%) has shot higher in afternoon trading. Rumors about a special dividend appear...

    Apple (AAPL +1.5%) has shot higher in afternoon trading. Rumors about a special dividend appear to be the trigger. (earlier: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 91 Comments
  • PGRX

    A double dose of downgrades (I, II) sends Prospect Global Resources (OTC:PGRX -12.6%) to new...

    A double dose of downgrades (I, II) sends Prospect Global Resources (OTC:PGRX -12.6%) to new 52-week lows on uncertainty around the junior miner's financing. Both firms see Apollo Global's failure to invest a planned $100M as a significant setback; the investment had helped distinguish PGRX from other junior miners and raised the likelihood of completing the Holbrook project.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • CYTR

    CytRx (CYTR +6.5%) moves up after posting a smaller FY12 net loss than expected. Its EPS came in...

    CytRx (CYTR +6.5%) moves up after posting a smaller FY12 net loss than expected. Its EPS came in at $0.78 per share versus the $0.80 per share loss a year ago. Sales were $100K, also beating Street estimates of $30K.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • CCJ

    Cameco (CCJ +2.2%) has hired Goldman Sachs and another unnamed bank to advise it on exploring a...

    Cameco (CCJ +2.2%) has hired Goldman Sachs and another unnamed bank to advise it on exploring a potential bid for a stake in U.K.-based uranium enrichment specialist Urenco, Sky News reports. The U.K. government, co-owners of Urenco with the German and Dutch governments, had expressed interest in a possible sale of its interest, which could be worth as much as £2B.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • ZIOP

    Ziopharm Oncology (ZIOP +1.8%) trades higher after intitiating Phase 2 clinical studies of...

    Ziopharm Oncology (ZIOP +1.8%) trades higher after intitiating Phase 2 clinical studies of Ad-RTS IL-12 in combination with palifosfamide to treat patients with non-resectable recurrent or metastatic breast cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • ITP

    Orient Paper (ONP -11.2%) slides after announcing preliminary unaudited financial results for Q4...

    Orient Paper (ONP -11.2%) slides after announcing preliminary unaudited financial results for Q4 and FY13. In Q4, its EPS came in at $0.11, a 62% decline Y/Y, on revenue of $43.5M. Full-year revenue was $151.1M, an increase of 0.3% compared to the previous year. The company released its preliminary results prior to the filing of its 10K because it has entered into negotiations for a potential sale of the land and buildings of its headquarters compound.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +2.4%) catches the Barron's bounce after Andrew Barry highlights the...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +2.4%) catches the Barron's bounce after Andrew Barry highlights the retailer's strong history of generating profits and its modest valuation compared to peers. The company has grown without raising a penny of debt led by a strong management team and could raise the interest of a big-name buyer. If there is a nitpick for Barry, it's the company's website which hasn't generated significant buzz or churned up enough sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • NRG

    NRG Energy (NRG +1.6%) shares are strong as UBS raises its price target to $28 from $26,...

    NRG Energy (NRG +1.6%) shares are strong as UBS raises its price target to $28 from $26, believing positive steps such as a scarcity adder will drive higher power forwards. The firm also "conservatively" assumes $300M/year in buybacks in 2014 and beyond vs. $1B/year in free cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • GE

    General Electric (GE -0.7%) says it's agreed to examine expanding its cleanup of pollutants from...

    General Electric (GE -0.7%) says it's agreed to examine expanding its cleanup of pollutants from a section of New York’s Hudson River after state Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli sought an investor vote on a study to widen the project. GE, which has already spent over $1B on cleanup efforts, discharged as much as 1.3M pounds of carcinogens into the river over a three-decade span, will complete a review this year to determine whether removing more contaminated dirt will help reduce future penalties.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 7 Comments
  • LLEN

    L&L Energy (LLEN +12.3%) spikes higher on release of its FQ3 results; EPS was $0.32,...

    L&L Energy (LLEN +12.3%) spikes higher on release of its FQ3 results; EPS was $0.32, and revenues rose 98% Y/Y to $59.8M. Says FQ3 coal mining production rose 253% Y/Y and 26% Q/Q to 233K tons.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • NOK

    Likely pressuring Nokia (NOK -1.9%) today is a downbeat note from Goldman's Rick Schafer....

    Likely pressuring Nokia (NOK -1.9%) today is a downbeat note from Goldman's Rick Schafer. Schafer, who's slashing his 2013-2015 revenue, EPS, and smartphone volume estimates, calls the feature set of the Lumia 720 and 520 "relatively undifferentiated," and notes a recent Goldman survey indicated "only around 41% of Win Phone owners chose to buy another Win-based device over the last six months." (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 30 Comments
  • INVA

    Theravance (THRX -1.6%) slips despite the announcement that it's entered into an exclusive...

    Theravance (THRX -1.6%) slips despite the announcement that it's entered into an exclusive commercialization agreement with Clinigen Group in the European Union, as well as certain other countries located in Europe, for Vibativ, a treatment for hospital-acquired pneumonia. THRX will receive a $5M upfront payment from Clinigen and is entitled to receive tiered royalties on net sales ranging from 20% to 30%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • AMX

    The Mexican government has Carlos Slim's American Movil (AMX -1.9%) and top TV broadcaster Grupo...

    The Mexican government has Carlos Slim's American Movil (AMX -1.9%) and top TV broadcaster Grupo Televisa (TV -0.6%) in its sights: a bill presented today would "would create an independent regulator that could designate companies as dominant, impose stiffer penalties on them and even break them up," according to a draft seen by Reuters. The bill, which could have trouble making it through a divided Congress, also mandates rivals be provided with cheaper access to Slim's networks (previous). Mobile carrier NII Holdings (NIHD +3.3%) is rallying.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • MHO

    M/I Homes (MHO +2.4%) gains after announcing the redemption of 2M of its outstanding depositary...

    M/I Homes (MHO +2.4%) gains after announcing the redemption of 2M of its outstanding depositary shares on April 10 at a price of $25 per Depositary Share plus unpaid dividends.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • HIBB

    The weak Q4 results from Dick's Sporting Goods are swaying sentiment on other sporting goods...

    The weak Q4 results from Dick's Sporting Goods are swaying sentiment on other sporting goods stocks. Decliners: Hibbett Sports (NASDAQ:HIBB) -2.0%, Big Five Sporting Goods (NASDAQ:BGFV) -0.5%, Cabelas (NYSE:CAB) -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • CALI

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTC:CALI +52%. BOSC +45%. ESYS +30%. CBMX +25%. LAS +25%. PAMT +15%. FONR...

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTC:CALI +52%. BOSC +45%. ESYS +30%. CBMX +25%. LAS +25%. PAMT +15%. FONR +15%. SCR +15%. SGOC +15%. RWC +14%.
    Midday top 10 losers: AEZS -21%. NSU -11%. CSIQ -11%. SPEX -11%. FREE -10%. DKS -10%. CERE -10%. CNIT-OLD -9%. ONP -9%. RDCM -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM -4.3%) reaffirms its Q1 revenue, EBITDA margin, and "normalized" EPS guidance as...

    Akamai (AKAM -4.3%) reaffirms its Q1 revenue, EBITDA margin, and "normalized" EPS guidance as today's annual investor summit gets rolling (webcast). The CDN leader also says it will now classify certain expenses previously included in its sales/marketing line as part of its cost of revenue (thus impacting gross margin), and will begin accounting for the tax impact of various non-GAAP expenses when calculating net income. Akamai expects the latter change will lower Q1 non-GAAP EPS by $0.05, but won't affect normalized EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • VLO

    Refiners are hit in reaction to a WSJ story calling attention to the squeeze they face from the...

    Refiners are hit in reaction to a WSJ story calling attention to the squeeze they face from the rising costs of complying with a federal mandate to use corn ethanol in fuel. An EPA proposal, which could be made final as soon as next month, could force refiners and fuel importers to use more than 14B gallons of ethanol, up from 13.3B in 2012. VLO -4%, MPC -1.7%, TSO -2.5%, HFC -2.7%, WNR -3%, PSX -1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 28 Comments
  • WYNN

    Casino stocks trade higher today with news on revenue from Macau looking good, but progress on...

    Casino stocks trade higher today with news on revenue from Macau looking good, but progress on an online poker bill in the U.S. looking even more promising.  Analysts think the race between Nevada and New Jersey to see online poker within their state borders a reality increases the odds of a federal online bill getting pushed through Congress after previous attempts faltered. Advancers: Boyd Gaming +3.3%, Las Vegas Sands +2.6%, MGM Resorts +1.6%, Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) +1.1%, Pinnacle +3.2%, Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR) +1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 2 Comments
  • OLN

    Shares of Olin (OLN +0.9%) move up after Monness Crespi Hardt raises its rating to Buy and put a...

    Shares of Olin (OLN +0.9%) move up after Monness Crespi Hardt raises its rating to Buy and put a $31 price tag on the shares. The firm says that approximately $500M has been spent by the company over the past two years to exit mercury cell production, build out bleach capacity and move its Winchester manufacturing capacity to Mississippi. Going forward, the depreciation schedule should rise, capex will drop and free cash flow is anticipated to expand rapidly.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • REN

    Resolute Energy (REN +5.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $13 price target (from $10) at...

    Resolute Energy (REN +5.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $13 price target (from $10) at Wunderlich, which notes REN has been busy acquiring assets in the Permian Basin whose horizontal potential provides significant potential upside. But if results don't pan out, the firm thinks the assets are strong from a vertical perspective and should drive nice growth going forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • BTU

    It's a rough day for coal stocks, as BMO cuts Peabody Energy (BTU -1.3%) and Walter Energy (WLT...

    It's a rough day for coal stocks, as BMO cuts Peabody Energy (BTU -1.3%) and Walter Energy (WLT -1%), believing both have relatively high debt levels and high stock valuations (also). Tudor Pickering downgrades James River (JRCC -7.5%), calling it a "more creative balance sheet restructuring option than coal market recovery play," and Deutsche Bank cuts its price target to $2.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • AEZS

    Shares of Aetna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) continue to plunge since their resumption of trading, now...

    Shares of Aetna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) continue to plunge since their resumption of trading, now down 29% at $1.86 after an independent data safety monitoring board recommended discontinuing ongoing Phase 3 studies of perifosine.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • ZNGA

    Yahoo M&A speculation has Zynga (ZNGA +7.7%) shorts fleeing for the exits. Wunderlich's...

    Yahoo M&A speculation has Zynga (ZNGA +7.7%) shorts fleeing for the exits. Wunderlich's Blake Harper sees Zynga as a possible buyout target for Yahoo (YHOO), whose M&A chief recently said the company is working on two "significant" acquisitions (without elaborating), as the Internet giant tries to strengthen its mobile/social positioning. 16.4% of Zynga's float was shorted as of Feb. 15.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 17 Comments
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (JAZZ +0.9%) moves higher today after Cantor Fitzgerald starts coverage...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (JAZZ +0.9%) moves higher today after Cantor Fitzgerald starts coverage with a Buy rating and $86.00 price target. Cantor calls JAZZ an attractive growth story that's been held back by generic concerns over its key revenue driver, Xyrem, a drug for the treatment of narcolepsy, which represents 69% of revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) resumes trading -10%.

    Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) resumes trading -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • AEZS

    Shares of Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS -1.9%) remain halted after the company says an independent Data...

    Shares of Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS -1.9%) remain halted after the company says an independent Data Safety Monitoring Board has recommended discontinuing ongoing Phase 3 studies comparing the efficacy and safety of perifosine in patients with relapsed or relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma. Based on its analysis, the DSMB reported that it was highly unlikely the study would achieve a significant difference in its primary endpoint.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • CSII

    Cardiovascular Systems (CSII +11%) rallies after the company says Orbit II trials of its...

    Cardiovascular Systems (CSII +11%) rallies after the company says Orbit II trials of its treatment therapy for patients with severely calcified coronary lesions had exceeded expectations by a significant margin. The study is reviewing the safety and effectiveness of it's orbital atherectomy technology and is the first Investigational Device Exemption study to seek approval for treating these lesions.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • CENX

    Kentucky state lawmakers are set to decide whether to let Century Aluminum (CENX -3.7%) buy...

    Kentucky state lawmakers are set to decide whether to let Century Aluminum (CENX -3.7%) buy power on the open market in its bid to save its money-losing smelter from closure. The bill could have implications for the U.S. aluminum industry, as high-cost electricity for aging plants has challenged producers to seek more efficient operations with aluminum prices dropping ~30% in two years.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • DKS

    Heard during the Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS +3.7%) earnings call: Responding to a question on...

    Heard during the Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS +3.7%) earnings call: Responding to a question on the delayed tax refund excuse for slumping Q1 sales marched out by major retailers such as Wal-Mart and AutoZone execs come clean. "We have no idea," they answer as they also note the impact (if any) can't be quantified. (More from DKS call)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • CALI

    China Auto Logistics (OTC:CALI +47%) soars as SA author Biotech Breakthroughs strays from his...

    China Auto Logistics (OTC:CALI +47%) soars as SA author Biotech Breakthroughs strays from his normal coverage area to tag the stock as poised for a big move higher. The imminent catalyst will be the announcement of an earnings release date, at which the writer expects big numbers to be reported.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE +4.2%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $15.50 price target at...

    Clean Energy Fuels (CLNE +4.2%) is initiated with a Buy rating and $15.50 price target at Ascendiant Capital, which says CLNE has become more vertically integrated and is becoming a one-stop shop for the emerging retail natgas market. CLNE's results are primarily driven by expanding fuel sales and the buildout of natural gas highway fueling infrastructure.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 3 Comments
  • BDSI

    BioDelivery Sciences International (BDSI +3%) gets a boost from a Piper Jaffray upgrade to...

    BioDelivery Sciences International (BDSI +3%) gets a boost from a Piper Jaffray upgrade to Overweight. Piper calls BDSI a value-added offering for pain and expects Phase III bioequivalence data for Bunavail to show a possible superiority to its other generic opioid dependence treatment Suboxone. Bunavail's NDA filing is planned for July and Phase III readout is expected by year-end or early 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +1.3%) breaks higher, fueled by chatter that a M&A adviser has been...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +1.3%) breaks higher, fueled by chatter that a M&A adviser has been hired by the company to help it explore strategic options.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • DKS

    Heard on the Dick's Sporting Goods (NYSE:DKS) earnings call: 1) For Q1, comparable-store sales...

    Heard on the Dick's Sporting Goods (NYSE:DKS) earnings call: 1) For Q1, comparable-store sales forecast to slip -2% to -1% . Higher merchandise margin seen offsetting escalating store costs during the period. 2) Investing in omnichannels and "shops" is a large focus from execs. 3) The company canceled some winter merchandise orders in December, but then lacked full inventory for the break toward cold weather in Q1. 4) The Lance Armstrong confession was bad for DKS business, in particular with Livestrong branded treadmills. DKS -7.0%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (WLT -3.3%), in the midst of a spat with a hedge fund that wants to replace half...

    Walter Energy (WLT -3.3%), in the midst of a spat with a hedge fund that wants to replace half its board, says it could further cut production at underperforming mines and explore the sale of non-core assets. BMO Capital cuts shares to Market Perform, believing WLT faces near-term headwinds given relatively high financial leverage and falling margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • BLDP

    Ballard Power (BLDP +5.2%) gains this morning after the company says it's inked an agreement...

    Ballard Power (BLDP +5.2%) gains this morning after the company says it's inked an agreement with the Center for Transportation and the Environment for a 150 kilowatt FCvelocity TM-HD6 fuel cell module to be integrated into a bus that will be deployed in Hartford, Connecticut. The fuel cell hybrid bus, which was jointly developed with BAE Systems (OTCPK:BAESY -0.2%)and ElDorado National and is already in operation with SunLine Transit Agency in Thousand Palms, California, is expected to be delivered in 2015.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • LDK

    Chinese solar stocks head south after (questionably named) Canadian Solar posts disappointing Q4...

    Chinese solar stocks head south after (questionably named) Canadian Solar posts disappointing Q4 results and guidance, and struggling Suntech announces a debt forbearance agreement rather than a bailout or refinancing deal. Suntech is generally seen as a litmus test for whether the Chinese government will continue to prop up local solar manufacturers. LDK -3.1%. SOL -5.1%. YGE -4.4%. JKS -4.3%. TSL -2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
